text.wmch.title: Where's My Chat History Configuration
text.wmch.time_desc: Should the timestamp in front of all messages show?
text.wmch.timeStr_desc: The text that is used for the timestamp. To add time values, see [https://i.imgur.com/KlBIDWf.png].
text.wmch.timeColor_desc: The color that is applied BEFORE the timestamp appearance modifiers, however it overrides any colors provided there.
text.wmch.timeFormatting_desc: The array of Formattings to modify the looks of the timestamp's text. See the name values at [https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Formatting_codes].
text.wmch.hover_desc: Should the text that appears when you hover over the timestamp show?
text.wmch.hoverStr_desc: The text that shows when you hover over the timestamp in front of all chat messages. For dynamic text, see [https://i.imgur.com/KlBIDWf.png].
text.wmch.counter_desc: Should the duplicate message counter show behind messages to indicate multiple were sent?
text.wmch.counterStr_desc: The text that's appended to the end of messages to indicate multiple of the same were sent. Must include a $ for the number of duplicates, and cannot have any numbers.
text.wmch.boundary_desc: Should the boundary line that shows when you use chat then leave and rejoin a game session show?
text.wmch.boundaryStr_desc: The text that is shown when a boundary line is inserted into the chat.
text.wmch.boundaryColor_desc: The color that is applied BEFORE the boundary appearance modifiers, however it overrides any colors provided there.
text.wmch.boundaryFormatting_desc: The array of Formattings to modify the looks of the boundary text. Ignores color values (Boundary color). See the name values at [https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Formatting_codes].
text.wmch.nameStr_desc: The text that replaces the playername in most references (if present). Vanilla would be <$>; no brackets $. $ represents the playername. Only for player messages.
text.wmch.maxMsgs_desc: The max amount of chat messages allowed to render. Not recommended to change, as it's automatically adjusted based on RAM allocation.
text.wmch.reset_desc: If this is toggled on, it will reset all options to their default values. This will exist as long as I don't know how to add a proper reset button.
